_prev_prog_3.Description: Facility has two processes but one shared Program 3 Prevention Program

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
EXECUTIVE SUMMARY

The following subsections outline the requirements of the EPA's 40 CFR Part 68.155



A. ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION AND EMERGENCY POLICIES

The top priority of Dickinson Frozen Foods facility is to provide a healthy and safe work environment

for its employees and the surrounding community. In this effort, the facility has developed strict

policies and procedures to reduce the risk of an accidental hazardous chemical release. The

Process Safety Management (PSM) program acts as a gatekeeper of these policies and procedures.



The requirements of the Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA) PSM Standard CFR

1910.119 mirrors that of Risk Management Prevention Program 3 and therefore has been

integrated. Of the 14 PSM elements, 13 focus on accidental release prevention and one on

emergency planning and response. It is the commitment of management and employees to follow

the established procedures and seek new ways for improvement.



B. STATIONARY SOURCE AND REGULATED SUBSTANCES HANDLED

The Dickinson Frozen Foods facility is located in Fruitland, Idaho. The facility operates two

independent systems at this location using Anhydrous Ammonia (CAS #7664-41-7) as the

refrigerant in the closed-loop systems. The total combined ammonia inventory exceeds the threshold

quantity for accidental release prevention.



C. ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION PROGRAM AND CHEMICAL-SPECIFIC PREVENTION STEPS

EPA's Risk Management Prevention Program 3, 40 CFR Part 68(D) and OSHA's Process Safety

Management Standard 29 CFR 1910.119 outline the facilities accidental release prevention program

below. The facility has committed to completing audits and inspections as well as holding employee

meetings to establish current procedures, ensure there is employee buy in for procedures and seek

new opportunities for improvement to health and safety policies. The system has many built-in safety

features including high-level controls and indicators, pressure

relief valves, automatic and manually

controlled valves and shutdowns, and leak detectors.



Employee Participation Program

Process Safety Information

Process Hazard Analysis

Operating Procedures

Training Program

Contractor Safety Program

Pre-Startup Safety Review Procedures

Mechanical Integrity Program

Hot Work Permit Procedures

Management of Change Procedures

Incident Investigation Procedures

Compliance Audit Procedures

Emergency Planning and Response



D. FIVE YEAR ACCIDENTAL RELEASE HISTORY

There have been no reportable releases.



E. EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM

Dickinson Frozen Foods is using Caldwell Fire Department as the first responder to an incident in

the event of an uncontrolled release. The facility has developed an Emergency Action plan to ensure

an efficient response in the event of an accidental hazardous substance release, fire, explosion or

any other emergency. The plan includes First Aid procedures and Emergency Medical Treatment

procedures, Evacuation plans, Notification/Communication.



F. PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFETY

Dickinson Frozen Foods is proactive in their approach to health and safety of its employees and

surrounding community. Any areas of improvement that can be identified in audits, hazard analyses

and inspections are identified, and corrective actions are taken in the event a recommendation is

made promptly.
